forgeLabs.problem: Hospitals allocate only 4.2% of AI budgets to governance (Black Book Research). 78% lack audit-ready AI policies. CIOs know they need governance but have no tool to plan/benchmark spend.
forgeLabs.solution: Self-service web app: input hospital size, AI project count, regulatory jurisdiction → get benchmark governance budget, policy gap checklist, audit-readiness score, and compliance timeline aligned to Joint Commission-CHAI 7 pillars.
forgeLabs.moat: Proprietary benchmark data from public reports (Black Book, Guidehouse/HIMSS, CHAI). Continuously updated regulatory requirements. FORGE's deep healthcare governance expertise.
forgeLabs.dataSource: Black Book Research reports, Guidehouse/HIMSS survey data, Joint Commission-CHAI framework, state AI law tracker (public legislative databases), CMS/HHS regulatory filings.
forgeLabs.competitionCheck: No direct competitor. Big consultancies do this manually at $50K+. No self-service tool exists for hospital AI governance budgeting.
forgeLabs.deployTo: Web app (forgelumen.ca subdomain), Azure Marketplace, potentially Teams app
forgeLabs.monetization: Freemium: free basic assessment, $49/mo for full benchmark dashboard + quarterly updates, $199/mo for multi-facility + compliance tracking
forgeLabs.reasoning: The Guidehouse survey (Feb 13) and Black Book report both confirm hospitals are flying blind on governance budgets. This is a pain point CIOs are actively feeling pre-HIMSS (March 9-12). Perfect timing to launch before the conference.

articles.title: Survey: Nearly 50% of Hospitals Aren't Ready to Implement AI at Scale
articles.takeaway: 78% of health systems have AI projects but only 52% are operationally ready. Top barriers: cybersecurity (48%), budget (48%), data quality (42%), lack of expertise (36%). Confirms FORGE's Activation Bridge thesis — the gap between AI ambition and execution is massive.
articles.linkedInAngle: Share the stat: '78% doing AI, 48% not ready.' Ask: 'What's the missing layer between AI pilots and scale?' Position runtime governance as the answer.

articles.title: Hospitals Are Underfunding AI Governance, Report Finds
articles.source: Healthcare Finance News / Black Book Research
articles.takeaway: Median hospital AI governance budget is just 4.2%. Only 22% could produce an auditable AI explanation within 30 days. Only 29% have enforced AI policies. This is LUMEN's exact value prop.
articles.linkedInAngle: Lead with '4.2% — that's what hospitals spend on AI governance.' Frame LUMEN as the answer to audit readiness without massive spend.

articles.title: Healthcare AI Regulation: New Compliance Requirements Every Provider Must Know
articles.takeaway: Joint Commission + CHAI voluntary certification program coming in 2026. Seven governance pillars defined. State-level AI laws accelerating (California, Illinois, New York). Federal-state tension from Trump EO. Runtime governance is becoming table stakes.
articles.linkedInAngle: Frame the regulatory convergence: 'Joint Commission certification + state laws + HTI-1 = governance isn't optional anymore. The question is: embedded or bolted on?'

linkedInPulse.person: Theresa Meadows, MS, RN — CIO in Residence at symplr
linkedInPulse.summary: AI governance and data readiness will define CIO success in 2026. Real value only when governance is foundational, not layered on after. 75% of healthcare IT leaders seeking platform-based approaches to combat fragmentation.
linkedInPulse.forgeAngle: Meadows validates FORGE's positioning — governance-first, not governance-later. LUMEN SDK is exactly the 'foundational' layer she's describing.

events.name: HIMSS Global Health Conference & Exhibition
events.relevance: 600+ sessions on AI, data governance, clinical informatics. ~1,000 exhibitors. THE event for FORGE visibility. CIO targets will be there.
events.action: Register if not already. Plan CIO meetings around the event.

events.name: AI for Hospitals & Health Plans Summit
events.location: New Orleans, LA (The Roosevelt, Waldorf Astoria)
events.relevance: Focused on clinical decision support, predictive analytics, AI governance. Smaller, more intimate — better for conversations. Directly aligned with LUMEN positioning.
events.action: Consider attending or speaking. Perfect audience for runtime governance pitch.

events.name: NVIDIA GTC AI Conference
events.relevance: Healthcare AI infrastructure track. Good for technical partnerships and understanding where compute is heading.
events.action: Monitor sessions remotely — $2,172 registration may not be worth it vs HIMSS.

video.title: Clinical AI Governance: What Clinicians Must Know in 2026
video.summary: Oncology and health policy leaders discuss risks of AI adoption without proper governance. Covers the gap between AI deployment speed and governance readiness.
video.forgeAngle: Validates the narrative that clinicians are worried about ungoverned AI. LUMEN addresses this at the middleware layer.

mindset.quote: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now. But the smartest time? Right before everyone realizes they need shade.
mindset.reflection: Sean — the Guidehouse survey just confirmed what you've been saying: hospitals are doing AI but can't govern it. 4.2% governance budgets. 22% audit-ready. You built LUMEN for exactly this moment. HIMSS is 3 weeks out. The shade is about to be in very high demand.
